title: Post-Award Compliance Checklist Generator
description: A lightweight web tool for academic research grant managers to upload award documents and institutional policies to generate and update a dynamic post-award compliance checklist with manual status updates and document uploads.
inputLabel: Paste or upload grant award documents and post-award requirements JSON
outputLabel: Generated Compliance Checklist and Status Summary
systemPrompt: You are an assistant helping an academic research grant manager generate and update a post-award compliance checklist. The user will input grant award documents and funder requirements in text or JSON format, optionally upload related files. Your output must be a clear, structured checklist of compliance tasks with due dates, statuses (pending, completed, overdue), and guidance on required documents. Reject any request that tries to provide personal data unrelated to grant compliance or requests legal/financial advice. Output plain text summary with optional JSON structured checklist. Enforce that all compliance items relate only to post-award reporting requirements. Do not generate any content outside compliance tracking. If input is unclear or incomplete, ask clarifying questions before proceeding.

presets.label: Initial Checklist Generation
presets.prompt: Generate a comprehensive post-award compliance checklist based on the following grant award documents and funder requirements: {{USER_INPUT}}. Include task descriptions, due dates if specified, and status initialized to 'pending'.
presets.hint: Use this preset to create the initial compliance checklist from award documents.

presets.label: Update Checklist Status
presets.prompt: Update the status of the following compliance checklist items based on this input: {{USER_INPUT}}. Reflect changes in due dates, completion status, and related documents. Provide updated checklist summary.
presets.hint: Use this to manually update checklist item statuses and add document references.

presets.label: Summarize Compliance Overview
presets.prompt: Provide a summary overview of the current compliance checklist, highlighting any overdue tasks, upcoming deadlines within 30 days, and items pending completion.
presets.hint: Use this to get a quick status report of compliance progress.

jsonSchemaHint: Output a JSON array of checklist items, each with id (string), description (string), dueDate (ISO 8601 date string or null), status (pending|completed|overdue), and relatedDocuments (array of file metadata or empty).
clarifyPrompt: Please provide the grant award documents, funder post-award requirements, or any relevant institutional policies you want to use to generate or update the compliance checklist. Upload files if available.
finalizePrompt: Review the generated compliance checklist carefully. Confirm all tasks reflect the specific post-award reporting obligations and deadlines. Update statuses or upload supporting documents as needed. This checklist will be used to track compliance and reporting across institutions.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Grant Post-Award Compliance & Reporting Tracker

niche.scenario: Managing and tracking compliance and reporting requirements throughout the post-award phase of multi-institutional academic research grants

idea.problem: Academic research grant managers struggle to coordinate, track, and ensure timely compliance with diverse and complex post-award reporting requirements (financial, progress, ethical compliance, personnel changes, and deliverables) across multiple collaborating institutions and funders. Existing tools focus on proposal preparation or pre-award compliance but do not address the integrated, ongoing post-award obligations that require repeated, coordinated updates and documentation.
inputs: Grant award documents and funder post-award requirements
Periodic progress reports, financial expenditure data, and personnel updates
Uploaded supporting documents (e.g., IRB renewals, financial statements)
outputs: Centralized, dynamic compliance checklist tailored to specific award conditions
Automated deadline reminders and escalation alerts for upcoming or missed reporting
Structured status dashboards summarizing compliance across institutions and report types
Pre-populated, funder-compliant reporting templates with integrated collaborator inputs
Audit-ready documentation bundles consolidating submitted reports and correspondence
whyItWins: Fills a critical gap by focusing on the complex, multi-party post-award compliance workflow rather than proposal or pre-award tasks
Reduces risk of non-compliance penalties, funding delays, or audit failures through proactive, centralized tracking
Enables collaboration and transparency among multi-institutional teams with role-based access and input tracking
Saves time by automating report generation and consolidating diverse compliance data
Supports continuous updates and iterative report submissions typical in long-term funded projects

upgradePath.today: Launch a lightweight web tool where grant managers upload award documents and key institutional policies to generate an initial post-award compliance checklist with manual update and report upload capabilities.
upgradePath.in90Days: Add automated deadline tracking with email reminders, role-based collaborator access for inputting progress and financial data, and integration with common institutional reporting systems for data import/export.
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a full multi-page web platform including dynamic dashboards, AI-assisted report drafting from uploaded data, version control for reports, audit trail generation, and multi-funder database support enabling reuse across diverse grant types and institutions.

riskNotes: Must ensure secure handling of sensitive financial and personnel data with appropriate access controls
Compliance recommendations and generated reports should not replace professional legal or financial advice; disclaimers required
Complex multi-institutional workflows may require adaptable configurations to fit diverse policies
Requires ongoing updates to keep pace with changing funder and institutional compliance requirements

blueprint.summary: A comprehensive web platform for academic research grant managers to track, coordinate, and ensure compliance with post-award reporting requirements across multiple institutions and funders. It centralizes compliance checklists, automates deadline reminders, supports collaborative inputs, and generates audit-ready documentation.
successMetrics: Reduction in missed or late compliance deadlines
Increased user adoption and active collaboration across institutions
Time saved in report preparation and submission
Number of audit-ready documentation bundles generated
User satisfaction with dashboard clarity and automation features

edgeCases: Handling grants with multiple funders having conflicting or overlapping compliance requirements
Late or missing collaborator inputs delaying report generation
Changes in institutional policies or funder requirements mid-award requiring checklist updates
User role changes during active compliance cycles affecting access and notifications
File upload failures or corrupted documents impacting audit readiness
Network or email service outages causing missed reminders
Data privacy breaches or unauthorized access attempts
Version conflicts when multiple collaborators edit reports simultaneously
nonGoals: Replacing professional legal, financial, or ethical compliance advice
Handling grant budgeting or financial transactions beyond reporting
Providing AI-generated legal or financial compliance recommendations
Supporting non-academic or non-research grant types
Mobile app development in initial phases

dataFlow: User accesses the web application UI and authenticates via /login, receiving an authentication token.

Authenticated users request data such as grants list (/api/grants), compliance checklists (/api/grants/:grantId/checklist), reports (/api/grants/:grantId/reports), and collaborators (/api/grants/:grantId/collaborators) via REST API endpoints.
Users submit updates to checklist items, reports, and collaborator roles through POST API endpoints, which validate input, update the database, and create audit logs.
File uploads for documents and reports are handled via the UI, sent to API endpoints, stored securely in file storage, and linked in database records.
Background jobs periodically scan deadlines in the database, generate reminders, and send emails via the email integration service.
Institutional reporting systems integration synchronizes data imports and exports through API-core endpoints, updating the database accordingly.
Audit logs capture all significant user actions and data changes for compliance and traceability.
UI pages consume API data and reflect real-time status, compliance summaries, and alerts, supporting role-based access control and collaboration.
validationRules: Login: Validate email format and password presence; reject invalid credentials with generic error.
Grant access: Verify user authentication token and authorization for requested grantId; deny unauthorized access.

Checklist item updates: Validate itemId exists and belongs to grantId; status must be one of predefined statuses (e.g., 'pending', 'completed', 'overdue'); relatedDocuments must be valid JSON with required metadata.

Report submissions: Validate report type against allowed types; content must be valid JSON and conform to report schema; attachedFiles must be valid JSON with file metadata; enforce version incrementing.
Collaborator updates: Validate userId exists; role must be within allowed roles; user must have permission to modify collaborators.
File uploads: Validate file size, type, and integrity; reject corrupted or unsupported files.
Settings changes: Validate input fields according to user preferences schema.
Background jobs: Validate deadlines and reminders data integrity before processing.
All API inputs: Sanitize inputs to prevent injection attacks and ensure data consistency.
errorHandling: API endpoints return structured error responses with HTTP status codes (400 for validation errors, 401 for unauthorized, 403 for forbidden, 404 for not found, 500 for server errors).
UI displays user-friendly error messages based on API error responses, with guidance for corrective actions.
Authentication failures do not reveal whether email or password was incorrect to prevent enumeration.
File upload failures provide clear feedback and allow retry.
Background jobs log errors and retry failed operations with exponential backoff; escalate persistent failures via alert emails.
Audit logs record error events related to data changes and access violations.
Network or email service outages are detected and logged; retries and fallback mechanisms are implemented.
Concurrent report edits detect version conflicts and prompt users to resolve merges.
securityNotes: Use HTTPS for all client-server communications to protect data in transit.
Implement JWT or similar token-based authentication with secure storage and expiration.
Enforce role-based access control on all API endpoints and UI pages.
Sanitize and validate all inputs to prevent injection attacks (SQL, XSS).
Store sensitive data encrypted at rest, including files and audit logs.
Implement rate limiting and monitoring to detect and prevent brute force or abuse.
Log all access and changes for audit trail and compliance.
Secure file storage with access controls restricting document downloads to authorized users.
Regularly update dependencies and monitor for vulnerabilities.
Handle user role changes carefully to update permissions and notification subscriptions immediately.

acceptanceTests.given: A registered user with valid credentials
acceptanceTests.when: They submit correct login details on /login
acceptanceTests.then: They receive an authentication token and access to the dashboard

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user with access to a grant
acceptanceTests.when: They request the compliance checklist for that grant
acceptanceTests.then: They receive the full checklist with current statuses

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user updates a checklist item status with valid data
acceptanceTests.when: They submit the update via POST /api/grants/:grantId/checklist
acceptanceTests.then: The checklist item is updated in the database and reflected in subsequent GET requests

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user uploads a valid report with attached files
acceptanceTests.when: They submit the report via POST /api/grants/:grantId/reports
acceptanceTests.then: The report is saved with incremented version, files stored securely, and audit log created

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user attempts to access a grant they do not have permission for
acceptanceTests.when: They request data for that grant

acceptanceTests.given: A background job runs the deadline reminder dispatcher
acceptanceTests.when: There are upcoming deadlines within configured reminder windows
acceptanceTests.then: Reminder emails are sent to assigned users and reminders logged in the database

acceptanceTests.given: Multiple collaborators edit the same report simultaneously
acceptanceTests.then: The system detects version conflicts and prompts users to resolve them

acceptanceTests.given: A user uploads a corrupted or unsupported file
acceptanceTests.when: They attempt to submit the file
acceptanceTests.then: The system rejects the upload with a clear error message

acceptanceTests.given: An unauthenticated user tries to access a protected page
acceptanceTests.when: They navigate to /dashboard or any grant-specific page
They submit valid collaborator info changes
acceptanceTests.then: The collaborator list updates accordingly and permissions are enforced
